bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, April 9, 1923

div1.p: Russell sends Carter a letter and report on the Colombia fever epidemic.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, April 9, 1923
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
F. F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
HERMANN M. RIGGS
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
FREDERICK T. GATES
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
April 9, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You will find enclosed copy of a letter
dated March 19 just received from Doctor Miller, en-
closing a report of the epidemic which recently broke
out in Bucaramanga, Colombia.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F. F. Russell Doctor Henry R. Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FRR:EP E
